intro: Pavetta trichardtensis var. trichardtensis, commonly known as the Trichardt pavetta, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
